newsitem.title: USA: SPS Transaction says Novus contract to end.
newsitem.headline: SPS Transaction says Novus contract to end.

text.p: SPS Transaction Services said Wednesday its contract to supply processing software to an affiliate will be terminated July 31, 2000.
SPS would not disclose the value of the contract.

Under the contract, which was signed in 1992, SPS provided software for credit card transaction processing to Novus Service Inc, the unit of Morgan Stanley, Dean Witter, Discover & Co. that runs the Discover Card, an SPS spokeswoman said. SPS is a majority owned unit of Morgan Stanley, Dean Witter.
Earlier SPS said it earned $9 million, or $0.33 a share, in the second quarter compared to $6.6 million, or $0.24 a share, in the same period last year.
